titleInfo.title: Pre-Columbian ceramic vessel with human motif

mods.abstract: Pre-Columbian vessel with a human face designed into the neck, containing two eyes, a protruding nose, and a slit mouth. On the opposite side from the face, a small handle extends from the neck. Just below the neck, two areas extend from the body on both sides of the face, which may represent shoulders. Vessel has a wide body, narrow base, and a white slip.
Shows signs of general wear. Body contains pencil markings.

titleInfo.title: Pre-Columbian vessels
Pre-Columbian cultural artifacts
George and Louis Patten collection of Salem Hyde papers and cultural artifacts

Metadata originally created in a locally modified version of Qualified Dublin Core using ContentDM (data dictionary available: https://dltn-technical-docs.readthedocs.io).
